v.v: This is what Yahweh says,
My hand has made all these things; that is how these things came to be—this is Yahweh’s declaration.
He who slaughters an ox also murders a man; he who sacrifices a lamb also breaks a dog’s neck;
In the same way I will choose their own punishment; I will bring on them what they fear,
Hear the word of Yahweh, you who tremble at his word,
A sound of battle tumult comes from the city, a sound from the temple,
Before she goes into labor, she gives birth;
Who has heard of such a thing? Who has seen such things?
Do I bring a baby to the birth opening and not permit the child to be born?—asks Yahweh.
Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her, all you who love her;
For you will nurse and be satisfied; with her breasts you will be comforted;
This is what Yahweh says,
As a mother comforts her child, so I will comfort you, and you will be comforted in Jerusalem.”
You will see this, and your heart will rejoice, and your bones will sprout like the tender grass.
For look, Yahweh is coming with fire, and his chariots are coming like the windstorm
For Yahweh executes judgment on mankind by fire and with his sword. Those killed by Yahweh will be many.
They consecrate themselves and make themselves pure, so they may enter the gardens, following the one in the middle of those who

v: “Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. Where then is the house you will build for me? Where is the place where I may rest?
This is the man of whom I approve, the broken and contrite in spirit, and who trembles at my word.
he who offers a grain offering offers swine’s blood; he who offers a memorial of incense also blesses wickedness.
They have chosen their own ways, and they take pleasure in their abominations.
because when I called, no one answered; when I spoke, no one listened.
They did what was evil in my sight, and chose to do what displeases me.”
“Your brothers who hate and exclude you for my name’s sake have said,
‘May Yahweh be glorified, then we will see your joy,’
but they will be put to shame.
the sound of Yahweh paying back his enemies.
before pain is upon her, she gave birth to a son.
Will a land be born in one day? Can a nation be established in one moment?
Yet as soon as Zion goes into labor, she gives birth to her children.
Or do I bring a child to moment of delivery and then hold it back?—asks your God.”
rejoice with her, all you who mourned over her!
for you will drink them to the full and be delighted with the abundance of her glory.
“I am about to spread prosperity over her like a river,
and the riches of the nations like an overflowing stream.
You will nurse at her side, be carried in her arms, and be dandled on her knees.
The hand of Yahweh will be made known to his servants, but he will show his anger against his enemies.
to bring the heat of his anger and his rebuke with flames of fire.
eat the flesh of pig and abominable things like mice.
“They will come to an end—this is Yahweh’s declaration.

v.v: For I know their deeds and their thoughts. The time is coming when I will gather all nations and languages. They will come and will see my glory.

I will set a sign among them. Then I will send survivors from them to the nations: To Tarshish, Put, and Lud, who draw the bow, to Tubal, Javan, and to the distant coastlands where they have not heard about me nor seen my glory. They will proclaim my glory among the nations.

They will bring back all your brothers out of all the nations, as an offering to Yahweh. They will come on horses, and in chariots, in wagons, on mules, and on camels, to my holy mountain Jerusalem—says Yahweh. For the people of Israel will bring a grain offering in a clean vessel into the house of Yahweh.
Some of these I will even choose as priests and Levites—says Yahweh.
For just as the new heavens and the new earth that I will make
From one month to the next, and from one Sabbath to the next,
They will go out and see the dead bodies of the men who have rebelled against me,

v: will remain before me—this is Yahweh’s declaration—so your descendants will remain, and your name will remain.
all people will come to bow down to me—says Yahweh.
for the worms that eat them will not die, and the fire that consumes them will not be quenched;
and it will be an abhorrence to all flesh.”
